Don't do it alone - join weight watchers and do it with others in the same situation - it provides a ssupport network and those weekly weigh ins are a great insentive

If you want dramatic results you will need to change boh your diet and exercise regime

Set youself targets eg aim to run a race for charity in 6 months time - this you can then train for (perhaps with a friend?)

You can crash diet like so many woemn try (and fail to maintain) But you will simply cause yourself to over eat when yiu eventually give up (trust me - you will!) and result in you putting on weight 10 times faster than you lost it and result in being heavier than you started

Don't stop eating, - eat frequently in small portions - if you only ate once a day you would slow your matabolism right down and your body would eneter into starvation mode - you would therefore keep hold of any calories and fat that you do eat and find it harder to keep the weight off.

Basically you need to make life chnages - that you can maintain throughout your lfe - not just for a week. Don't cut out food groups altogether - as it will result in you craving these and over eating other types of food. Endulge every so often - its all about moderation

And simple mathematics - if you burn off what you eat - you WILL loose weight :)
